New Records: Coby White made a career-high nine 3-pointers
Key Match Events: The Bulls outscored the Knicks 41-17 in the third quarter
With the game tied at 84, they outscored the Knicks 20-5 over the final four minutes of the quarter
Karl-Anthony Towns led the Knicks with 44 points and 16 rebounds
Pre-Game Insights: The team honored Rose, the Chicago product, at halftime after announcing in the morning that he will join Michael Jordan, Scottie Pippen, Jerry Sloan and Bob Love as the only players whose numbers have been retired by the franchise sometime next season
Post-Match Reflections: The Bulls shook off a sluggish first half and dominated down the stretch
Miscellaneous Highlights: Chicago outscored New York by 24 in the third quarter after trailing by nine at halftime
The Knicks have back-to-back losses for the third time this season
They have not dropped more than two in a row
The Bulls capped off a feel-good day on a winning note
